This is really the bull case cry for stacking firearms and putting aside enough to buy sell swords. The government will do anything they think they can get away with which I why I don't think even bail ins are certain, you can do those overnight without kicking a single door but there will still be hell to pay in the morning. While stackers are a smaller population most holdings require, or rather will at such time require, going door to door to seize assets in a country in which one can put together an AR for $350-$400 and drop in FRTs can be had for as little as $100. All this against the population and asset class pairing most likely to own firearms. The logistics don't make sense. You'll see heavy taxes, threats of taxes, capital controls and possibly if briefly bans on sales after a set date. None of this yields as much gold or silver as paying an above market rate. Question is, is there anything worth trading for. If I got a deed to a substantial amount of the land the federal government loves to horde so much I could see myself parting with all (some) of my specie. Nobody can be all stick and no carrot and win. This is why in bank bail ins you atleast get shares in a bank that has recently defaulted.

item.title: Oldfags on this board... what was it like hunting for a job in 2021-2022 ? — 9 replies — 16.1/hr
item.content:encoded:
Oldfags on this board... what was it like hunting for a job in 2021-2022 ?

Open thread • Replies: 9 • Updated: 2026-02-18 06:45 UTC

OP

>be me
>zoomer wagie stuck in application hell
>look at the linkedin of every mid-level manager/engineer at FAANG/Fortune 500
>notice a pattern
>literally every single one of them (mostly jeets/chinks) got hired between 2020-2022 while I was still in high school
>mfw

Is it just me or was the bar literally on the floor back then? What was the "process" even like for you dinosaurs? Did you just walk in, pulse check, firm handshake, and get handed a 250k TC package with stock options?

Explain to me how you guys actually got hired during the infinite money glitch era without sounding like you just got lucky.

Early replies (first 3)

61868988
>>61868983
they reached out to me from LinkedIn and asked me to interview. I interviewed with them, passed the interview and then they hired me. They asked me to fill out the job application paperwork after I already did a few interviews to "make it official". Then I got an offer for close to 400k TC and took it.

61869002
>>61868983
Nobody wanted to work because covid relief was so good. You could make more on unemploymenr than working and you could put off paying a lot of your bills. Getting a job was easy if you wanted one.

61869003
>>61868983
I graduated with a degree in Physics in December 2019. Covid hit early 2020. I worked at a gas station for 4 months before getting factory work. I worked on the factory floor for all of covid, and only got a job in my field in 2023. It was hell.

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61869023
>>61868983
Hiring managers and recruiters were cold calling everyone with tech experience and offering high paying jobs after first interview. It was kind of nuts. I wish I knew just how desperate companies were back then because I could have gotten a much better job than the one I took.

61869024
It's not the timing, it's because they're Indian.

61869068
>>61868983
>Job hunting in 2021 is oldfag status
>mfw when 40

61869072
>>61868983
I graduated a year before covid and the company I work for basically had a policy where they didn't hire new grads that didn't graduate before covid.

61869094
got a random email one day asking me if I wanted to join their company, no resume or anything, and thats where I am today

61869113
>>61868983
I started applaying for a new job in jan 21 and in april i landed a new one with 50% increase. After a few months i started applying again and in 22 i got a remote job with almost 100% salary increase and a more favourable taxation. This kind of leap is the easiest early in your career, it gets much more difficult later.

item.title: Need 10 Players to test this game — 12 replies — 13.1/hr
item.content:encoded:
Need 10 Players to test this game

Open thread • Replies: 12 • Updated: 2026-02-18 06:23 UTC

OP

I built a 1v1 trading game on Base.

How it works:
Both players stake $1 USDC
You trade a synthetic asset (NOVA) for 60 seconds
Best P&L wins the pot

No tokens needed. No sign up. Just connect wallet and play.

Looking for 10 players to battle this week.
Drop a if you want in.

playmomentum.app

Early replies (first 3)

61868771
>>61868759
How do I know you aren't some disgusting Indian trying to scam me and hack my wallet?

61868780
>>61868759
I'm not connecting a wallet to that but I'll bump your thread out of interest

61868808
Fair question. The code is fully open — smart contracts verified on BaseScan, no proxy, no admin mint, no way to touch your funds. The game uses EIP-3009 (gasless USDC approval) so you sign exactly what you stake, nothing more. Contract: https://basescan.org/address/0xe25f33862c0c0357e8bB62bE89C18c560Ea51D5f — read it yourself. I'm a solo dev, not a team of 50 with a Cayman Islands LLC. If I wanted to scam I'd pick a method that doesn't take 8 months to build.

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61868811
Appreciate the bump anon. If you change your mind, Practice mode doesn't need any funds — just a wallet connection to try the trading UI. No USDC required.

61868821
>>61868771
Fair question. The code is fully open — smart contracts verified on BaseScan, no proxy, no admin mint, no way to touch your funds. The game uses EIP-3009 (gasless USDC approval) so you sign exactly what you stake, nothing more. Contract: https://basescan.org/address/0xe25f33862c0c0357e8bB62bE89C18c560Ea51D5f — read it yourself. I'm a solo dev, not a team of 50 with a Cayman Islands LLC. If I wanted to scam I'd pick a method that doesn't take 8 months to build.

61868853
>>61868821

Sounds like a cool idea anon. If this is real and not a scam I would abandon this shit /biz/ thread and just sell this shit to sites like PolyMarket and Kalshi through corporate channels. Make some fucking money bro.

61868856
>>61868853
haha glad to hear that you can see there's no scam. I just want to be a CEO for the first time ever

61868872
need moar playersssssss please!

early adopters can also propose ideas, sounds, like trumps or bogdanoff

61868991
>hey testing this game
>connect your wallet
get so fucking fucked you jeet

61869012
so its kind of like type racer: you can play on your browser and battle randoms that queued up at the same time as you? (1v1 in this case)
my only questions: how do you win? you're allowed to buy/sell the asset as much as you want within 60 seconds? you can even do once while your opponent does it 20 times? also, I'm not much into crypto, whats a synthetic asset? do they really move up and down so much within the 1 minute?
If I understand this correctly, this is gonna be big with people that suck at real trading but can get some of that excitement they need. I'm literally thinking of two friends right now that should stay off real stock trading so much (they are losing money in the long term) and should instead steak less money and play this type racer trading game for a quick fix while they work from home anyway. It's like the vaping for their cigarettes

61869043
>>61868759

61869078

>, you all didnt even post a response to the view key fud thats even worth a damn till yesterday

Your question had been answered THREE YEARS before you even posed it. On the platform you all preferred. Have any of you gone back and said something like 'Thanks for telling me about this' or 'Well this eases my mind' or 'Guess I was wrong'? Of course not. >>61857490

Nothing ever happens.

Stop putting your vibes and feelings into your job search, learn to get better skills and be more marketable to employers.

McDonalds is always hiring

Funny isn't it?

61863218
>>61860719

61863252

61863679
>>61857500

61864332
>>61857490
End of the Juglar cycle. Overproduction crisis. Fed interest rates plunging toward zero. Soon an other Capital idling necessary.

61864333
>>61863679
Capital final crisis since 2008.

61864989
>>61863206
2006 was giving out loans like candy to people who had absolutely no way of ever servicing them
this then resulted in a lot of forced selling into a no bid market as all of this inventory was cleared when the bubble popped

right now we dont have excessive loans, quite the opposite retards arent given insane loans this is legit existing money bidding up hard assets because so much money got printed and it has to go somewhere
you dont get a crash in housing without forced selling and who is going to force sell his real estate at low prices without the bank margin calling them
unlike stocks which are completely fungible and its price is set at the margin, housing isnt and the owner can just sit on the asset forever and not be forced to take any offer being made at market price

to disrupt this 'bubble' you need the government unprinting the money supply (lol, lmao even) or you need a large section of boomers dying off and leaving their heirs with no way to pay the taxes/upkeep and force dump it
the second one is the only realistic option, tho there is also the risk that the heirs can pay for the inheritance and real estate is now permanently locked up in magnate hands and the nation reduced to permarenting slave

61865001
It really isn't mentioned enough that our "recovery" after 2008 was just setting interest rates to 0 for 10 years.

61865048
>>61864989
>...a large section of boomers dying off and leaving their heirs with no way to pay the taxes/upkeep...real estate is now permanently locked up in magnate hands....
You've laid out exactly what's been going on since 2008

61865068
>>61865048
yes thats the point, the implication here is that real estate is now permanently priced out of the middle class income range
not that a crash is imminent like the anon i was replying to seemed to suggest

61865501
>>61857490
I knew it was really over when Wendy's and pizza Hut announced theyre closing hundreds of stores.

61865585
>>61857490
Idk these terms, and economics is a fraudulent science anyways, so I'll just say what I see.

My life sucks.
Its getting worse.
I am watching generational decline among my family (each new set of kids struggle more than their parents).
People seem unhappy.

Call that recession, depression, or economic boon! Idc, US is a shithole.


I'm sure people will respond saying I'm cherry picking. Dishonesty is rampant.

61865659
>>61857779
>Foreign money taking investments out of the US because trump is an unpredictable fucking moron being puppeteered by unironically evil people

>Constant tariff bullshitery that is objectively hurting American industries that rely on imports
>Nuked basedbean deal with China on top of farmers needing a fucking bailout because of the retard they voted in (again)
>Tourism industry cratering every day as we speak so even less money being injected into the economy
>ICE operation have caused businesses across the country to shut down because either no one's willing to go out, or because they don't want random goons in masks harassing employees
Dude it's actually impressive how hard these retards just destroyed the entire reputation of america abroad and fucked us over domestically, but his cult fan base and circle of wannabe oligarchs who own media outlets will continue telling you that there is no war in ba sing se

Actually reflects living standards instead of billions of dollars getting spitswapped between 3-4 different AI companies constantly. Then again, most of the people hear would just ree hearing the term “5 year plan” or “stability focused infrastructure development.”

>>61865585

61866130
>>61860705
None of these are necessary. We could be totally self-sufficient, even for things like rare-earths. The Epstein class decided that would be bad for them so we aren't.

61866186
>>61866130
>pharmaceuticals are not necessary
>input goods for new tech are not necessary
Uh huh. So what’s necessary? Shovels, canned food and farmland? If you want to be Amish so badly just do it, nobody is stopping you.

In the real world, though, self-sufficiency would entail access to pharmaceuticals and the ability to evolve technologically and keep up with the first world. We can sing songs all day about how the US could be self-sufficient one day and that’s fine. The point is that we aren’t.

61866312
>>61866130
You're retarded if you actually believe this. Even IF we could be self sufficient, and make everything we need ourselves (we can't) the price of everything would fucking skyrocket to the point that most people wouldn't be able to afford common items that we have now like tvs and phones.
